Articles.Content: Would it be possible to add howitzers to the weapons manager? So that you could have a battery of them and either use the weapons manager to fire them one after the other to get around the long reload time or click to fire a volley.

Small Update

v0.5.1

- changed bullet trail type to LineRenderer so it will always be visible

- changed flare particle to local space

- Packaged BDAnimationModules.dll

The first point is actually kinda important. Before, quite often bullets/tracers would be invisible if there are too many particles or objects on the screen.

What are the permissions like for modifying the code? If it's allowed I would like to request a Skillfull compatibility fork for this mod. Just a damage system swap to let these beautiful parts be used alongside Skillful's armor

I put it under the CC-BY-SA license, so I guess you just have to give me credit. I'm kinda a noob at the whole programming thing so I don't know how forks work. Shoot me a PM.

I have just downloaded the mod, but the turrets and cannons don't work, however, the missiles are all in working order, is this a known bug? Or just a corrupted download?

This is usually caused by improper installation. Just put the BDArmory folder in the GameData folder.

This is absolutely awesome. The weapon mod we've been waiting for since C7's planes first flew. I have one question. How do I turn down the volume of the damned guns? My heart can't take another jump scare from my Vulcans.

The guns volume is tied to the "Ship volume" slider in the game settings, but it doesn't scale correctly. I'll try to get it to work properly.

So whats next? We got bombs, a good variety of missiles, plenty of guns, A howitzer and a tank gun, I suppose we need more bombs.

For now, I'll probably just work on polishing certain things and adding some features like target leading, aimers, integrating turrets to the weapon manager, AI, etc.

OK, I've got an idea. Radar systems. Namely, to fire some missiles (like AMRAAM), you'd need a radar nosecone/blister on your plane. Also, an AI SAM/AAG system would require another, different-looking radar to work. There could be also a HARM missile, which would automatically home in on an active air defense radar when launched.
